page.title: 04York City Football Club
page.content: York Football is probably the most popular sport for boys in 1985 and 3rd division York City has a lot of support in this area. Two York players live in Rawcliffe. Derek Hood from Washington on Tyne-side has played for York for 5 years. Keith Houchen is from Middlesborough and has played here for two years. They train at Clifton Hospital ground for 6 hours a day out of season and 2\ hours in season. They say they enjoy living in Rawcliffe because of good amenities and friendly people. Recent cases of football hooliganism in this country and abroad have shocked Derek Hood and Keith Houchen prefers "kicking a ball to kicking players." Recent successes mean bigger attendances (average 5691) and despite occasional incidents York has a family club reputaion.
